class.rdfs:comment: A muscle is an anatomical structure consisting of a contractile form of tissue that animals use to effect movement.
class.rdfs:label: Muscle

schema:action.rdfs:comment: Obsolete term for muscleAction. Not to be confused with potentialAction.
schema:action.rdfs:label: action

schema:antagonist.rdfs:comment: The muscle whose action counteracts the specified muscle.
schema:antagonist.rdfs:label: antagonist

schema:bloodSupply.rdfs:comment: The blood vessel that carries blood from the heart to the muscle.
schema:bloodSupply.rdfs:label: bloodSupply

schema:insertion.rdfs:comment: The place of attachment of a muscle, or what the muscle moves.
schema:insertion.rdfs:label: insertion

schema:nerve.rdfs:comment: The underlying innervation associated with the muscle.
schema:nerve.rdfs:label: nerve

schema:origin.rdfs:comment: The place or point where a muscle arises.
schema:origin.rdfs:label: origin
